humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides a tumor size of 3.3 x 1.8 x 3.2 cm. According to the rules, T2 tumors are more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm. The tumor size in this report falls within this range, so the pathologic T stage of the patient's cancer is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage for cancer is determined by the size of the tumor. In this report, the tumor size is described as 3.3 x 1.8 x 3.2 cm. The T stage for a tumor of this size, based on the TNM staging system, is T2. The T2 category is used when the tumor is larger than 2 cm in greatest dimension but not larger than 5 cm. The report also mentions that the tumor is placed 2.2 cm from the lower edge, 0.3 cm from the base and 2.8 cm from the skin, but these measurements do not factor into the T stage determination.
